name: v1.18.0
body:
## Improved logging in Queue Processor mode

`v1.18.0` introduces the `logFormatVersion` Helm chart option, to allow you to opt-in to more detailed logs.

The default value is `1`, which keeps logging the same way it did in prior releases (<= `v1.17.3`).

Setting the value to `2` will give you more detail about which AWS event triggered the cordon/drain. Previously, all these events were bucketed under `SQS_TERMINATE` and it was difficult to tell what was happening.

This option is also available as a command line flag, `--log-format-version`

### What does the new logging look like?

`logFormatVersion=2` modifies several Debug, Info, and Warn logs, as well as Kubernetes events emitted by NTH. These changes improve your observability about what NTH is doing when responding to events via SQS. If your monitoring system is configured to look for any of the specific strings in the tables below, you may need to modify your configuration to use the updated strings if you use the new log format version.

#### Changes to logs when starting up

1. Remove `event_type` field from the **Info log** when starting a monitor; replace with `monitor_type` field, with new values. See Table 1.
2. Remove `event_type` field from the **Warn log** when a monitor fails to start; replace with `monitor_type` field, with new values. See Table 1.

#### Changes to logs when processing an event

1. New `monitor` field in the **Info log**. See Table 1.
2. Potentially change value of `kind` field in the **Info log**, if running Queue Processor mode. See Table 2.
3. Potentially change the "reason" field in the **k8s event** if running Queue Processor mode. See Table 3.

#### Changes to logs when receiving an SQS message

1. Include the specific event type instead of `SQS_TERMINATE` in the **Debug log** if running Queue Processor mode. See Table 2.

#### Tables of changed values
##### Table 1: Monitor types
|Previous|New|
|---|---|
|`REBALANCE_RECOMMENDATION`|`REBALANCE_RECOMMENDATION_MONITOR`|
|`SCHEDULED_EVENT`|`SCHEDULED_EVENT_MONITOR`|
|`SPOT_ITN`|`SPOT_ITN_MONITOR`|
|`SQS_TERMINATE`|`SQS_MONITOR`|

##### Table 2: Event types
|Previous|New|
|---|---|
|`REBALANCE_RECOMMENDATION`|`REBALANCE_RECOMMENDATION`|
|`SCHEDULED_EVENT`|`SCHEDULED_EVENT`|
|`SPOT_ITN`|`SPOT_ITN`|
|`SQS_TERMINATE`|`REBALANCE_RECOMMENDATION` `SCHEDULED_EVENT` `SPOT_ITN` `STATE_CHANGE` `ASG_LIFECYCLE`|

##### Table 3: Event reasons
|Previous reason|New reason|
|---|---|
|`RebalanceRecommendation`|`RebalanceRecommendation`|
|`ScheduledEvent`|`ScheduledEvent`|
|`SpotInterruption`|`SpotInterruption`|
|`SQSTermination`|`RebalanceRecommendation` `ScheduledEvent` `SpotInterruption` `StateChange` `ASGLifecycle`|

### Commits with these changes
* feat: emit pod events on drain by @trutx in https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/703
* chore: add annotations to events in SQS mode by @trutx in https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/715
* fix: show actual event kinds in Queue mode by @trutx and @cjerad in https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/725

## Other changes
* README: Clarify distinctions between IMDS and QP modes by @snay2 in https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/695
* Clarify wording about using ASG tags. Fix broken docs link. by @snay2 in https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/721
* Remove bespoke Prometheus helm chart and use the latest public release instead by @snay2 in https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/723
* upgrade to Go 1.19 by @cjerad and @snay2 in https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/726


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/compare/v1.17.3...v1.18.0

name: v1.17.0
body:
## ⚠️ Callouts ⚠️

These may be breaking changes, depending on your setup:

* Remove calls to ASG APIs when determining whether NTH should manage an instance.
  * If you use ASGs but do _not_ propagate tags to your EC2 instances, **NTH may stop managing those instances**. This is because NTH will now only check tags on the instance itself to determine whether NTH should manage that instance.
* Deprecate two config values. Release `v1.17.0` supports both configs, but you'll see a warning if you use the deprecated name. We may remove the deprecated configs altogether in a future release.
  * Deprecate `CheckASGTagBeforeDraining` and replace it with `CheckTagBeforeDraining`
  * Deprecate `ManagedAsgTag` replace it with `ManagedTag`

## What's Changed

* Filter managed non-ASG nodes by tag by @AustinSiu in https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/669
* feat(observability): add eventID to exposed metrics by @cmotta2016 in https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/652
* Update infra setup steps for multi-cluster by @AustinSiu in https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/653
* Handle scheduled events immediately in IMDS mode, the same as queue processor mode by @snay2 in https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/661
* chore(README): add hint about EKS managed node groups by @m00lecule in https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/664
* Remove runAsUser in helm template for windows node by @pmcenery-bl in https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/663

## New Contributors
* @cmotta2016 made their first contribution in https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/652
* @m00lecule made their first contribution in https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/664
* @pmcenery-bl made their first contribution in https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/663

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/compare/v1.16.5...v1.17.0

* Fix custom nodeAffinity via values.yaml by @ngoyal16 in https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/515
* Support custom labels by @nlamirault in https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/529
* Add configurable taint effect by @hamishforbes in https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/539
* Remove exit when cordon failed by @liorfranko in https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/552
* Wrap volumes key in conditional to protect from being nil by @gaffneyd4 in https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/555

name: v1.13.4
body:
## Changes
  - feat(chart): Stop using hostPort on deployment [#501](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/501) (thanks to Steve Hipwell)
  - add bug and feature templates [#502](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/502) (thanks to Bryan™)
  - Fix slowdown and stoppage in the main event loop [#499](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/499) (thanks to Michael F Booth)
  - up sqs max messages and lower wait time and visibility timeout on messages [#496](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/496) (thanks to Brandon Wagner)
  - Add metrics documentation [#491](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/491) (thanks to Aidan)
  - Add cordon reason in log messages for cordon operations [#490](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/490) (thanks to Steve Nay)
  - fix docker layer caching [#489](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/489) (thanks to Brandon Wagner)
  - aws-node-termination-handler chart: use .Values.webhookTemplateConfig* parameters [#488](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/488) (thanks to Stanislav Vitkovskiy)
  - Add extraEnv to helm chart [#485](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/485) (thanks to jrsherry)

 - fixes #423: Populate pod list in webhook notification [#464](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/467) (thanks to Abhay Verma)

name: v1.13.1
body:
## Changes
  - add pods to webhook event and log pods on node [#447](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/447) (thanks to Brandon Wagner)
  - feat: Enable sprig template function library to webhook template renderer [#445](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/445) (thanks to Antonis Stamatiou)
  - add licenses for sprig and transitive deps [#446](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/446) (thanks to Brandon Wagner)
  - change drop message log to WARN instead of ERR [#444](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/444) (thanks to Brandon Wagner)
  - make queue-processor mode replicas configurable [#443](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/443) (thanks to Brandon Wagner)
  - fix rolebinding kind [#442](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/442) (thanks to Brandon Wagner)
  - Switch IMDSv2 token warning message to debug [#440](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/440) (thanks to Markos Chandras)
  - fix psp role [#435](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/435) (thanks to Brandon Wagner)
  - always do license check and use dockerhub for go-report-card image pulls [#432](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/432) (thanks to Brandon Wagner)
  - remove install-awscli [#431](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/431) (thanks to Bryan™)
  - remove beta notice for queue-processor mode [#430](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/430) (thanks to Brandon Wagner)
  - remove tty on container execs [#429](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/429) (thanks to Brandon Wagner)
  - Populate pods list to drain event [#428](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/428) (thanks to Abdul Muqtadir Mohammed)
  - don't exit(1) in queue processor mode [#422](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/422) (thanks to Stephen Schlie)
  - Upgrade to Go 1.16 and fix report-card [#427](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/427) (thanks to Bryan™)
  - Correct instantiation of AWS session object [#421](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/421) (thanks to Matt Dainty)
  - feat: ability to emit Kubernetes events [#411](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/411) (thanks to Roger Torrentsgenerós)
  - Clarify EventBridge Rules setup [#419](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/419) (thanks to Bryan™)
  - fix: error handling for missing instances [#409](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/409) (thanks to Jason Haugen)
  - rename InterruptionEvent.Drained to InterruptionEvent.NodeProcessed [#410](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/410) (thanks to Quan Hoang)

name: v1.13.0
body:
## Changes
  - fixed and improved region detection within queue url [#403](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/403) (thanks to Brandon Wagner)
  - fix undefined log levels [#402](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/402) (thanks to Brandon Wagner)
  - feat: add ability to drain on rebalance [#400](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/400) (thanks to Roger Torrentsgenerós)
  - Switch to use SQS long polling [#401](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/401) (thanks to Tristan Keen)
  - SPOT_POD_IP is not used [#396](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/396) (thanks to James Callahan)

name: v1.12.2
body:
## Changes
  - Implement Liveness probe [#389](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/389) (thanks to Yauheni Sliaptsou)
  - Update ClusterRole to include get for pods [#391](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/391) (thanks to Abdul Muqtadir Mohammed)
  - Add running pods to webhook notifications [#388](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/388) (thanks to Abdul Muqtadir Mohammed)
  - Provide node labels for webhook template [#382](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/382) (thanks to Abdul Muqtadir Mohammed)
  - Provide AutoScalingGroupName for webhook notifications [#384](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/384) (thanks to Abdul Muqtadir Mohammed)
  - Add node name to webhook template [#379](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/379) (thanks to Abdul Muqtadir Mohammed)

name: v1.12.1
body:
## Changes
  - Drop sqs messages for absent nodes [#375](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/375) (thanks to Jason Haugen)
  - Update stale.yml (thanks to Jillian Kuentz)
  - Add support to override pod monitor namespace [#372](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/372) (thanks to Victor Boissiere)
  - helm: added necessary hostPorts in the PodSecurityPolicy [#371](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/371) (thanks to Maxime VISONNEAU)
  - Update README.md [#370](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/370) (thanks to Brandon Wagner)
  - Fix goreportcard test and run make fmt [#369](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/369) (thanks to Jason Haugen)
  - Sqs deletion issue 360 [#364](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/364) (thanks to Andrew Zenk)
  - Update stale.yml (thanks to Jillian Kuentz)
  - clarify queue processor install instructions [#366](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/366) (thanks to Bryan™)
  - Avoid noisy error on scheduled events without NotAfter [#363](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/363) (thanks to Tristan Keen)
  - Update stale.yml [#362](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/362) (thanks to Jillian Kuentz)
  - Clarify podTerminationGracePeriod docs [#351](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/351) (thanks to Gabe Gorelick)
  - Document that deleteLocalData defaults to true, not false [#350](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/350) (thanks to Gabe Gorelick)
  - add sync readme to ecr public [#345](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/345) (thanks to Bryan™)
  - fix release prep for gh actions [#343](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/343) (thanks to Bryan™)
  - Update README.md [#342](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/342) (thanks to Bryan™)
  - Update Chart.yaml [#341](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/341) (thanks to Bryan™)

name: v1.12.0
body:
## New Features 🎉
* **Multithreaded event processor:** NTH now supports parallel processing of events when using Queue-Processor mode! The number of processors can be configured via `workers` parameter described [here](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/tree/main/config/helm/aws-node-termination-handler#aws-node-termination-handler---queue-processor-mode-configuration). Thanks @universam1 [#317](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/317)

## Improvements 🚀
* Add logic to publish images to ECR on release
* Fixes to improve release process

name: v1.11.2
body:
## Changes
  - publish images to ecr public repo (#325)

name: v1.11.1
body:
# Bug Fixes 🐛
* fixed volume name of daemonsets to follow DNS-1123 standard: [#300](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/300) thanks @n0gu 
* fixed crashes on EC2 Instance State-change Notification events: [#307](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/issues/307) thanks @universam1 
* added `logLevel` as a helm installation parameter [#312](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/312)
* fixed duplicate error checking [#314](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/314)

name: v1.11.0
body:
# New Features 🎉
* Adds configurable `ManagedAsgTag` option allowing users to run NTH in sqs queue processing mode across multiple clusters in an account (#272  thanks @blakestoddard  &  @paalkr)

# Improvements 
* Reduce NTH startup time across all modes via lowering IMDS retry rate (#281)

name: v1.10.0
body:
## Introducing EC2 Instance Rebalance Recommendation 🎉🎉🎉
NTH v1.10.0 adds support for [EC2 Instance Rebalance Recommendations](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/rebalance-recommendations.html), a notification directed towards Spot Instances that are at an elevated risk of interruption!

For `v1.10.0`, upon receiving the Rebalance Recommendation, NTH will **cordon the node only**; however, we encourage users to submit feedback if more configuration flexibility is desired!

Start consuming this new notification today with these quick-start configurations:
* **IMDS Processor:** `--set enableRebalanceMonitoring=true`
* **Queue Processor:** Create an Amazon EventBridge rule for `EC2 Instance Rebalance Recommendations`

Reference the [Installation and Configuration](https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler#installation-and-configuration) sections of the ReadMe to learn more!

## Other Changes: 
 - NTH Queue Processor mode now logs at debug level when a node termination event is received but the ASG is not tagged w/ the NTH managed tag `aws-node-termination-handler/managed`(Thanks to @kppullin https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/274)

name: AWS Node Termination Handler v1.9.0
body:
# 🎊🎊🎊🎊🎊  NTH Queue Processing Mode (Preview) 🥳🥳🥳🥳🥳

This release adds support for a new mode of operation for NTH called **queue-processor**. Until now, NTH has operated by monitoring the EC2 Instance Metadata Service (IMDS) for spot ITN events and EC2 scheduled maintenance events. The new queue-processor mode allows NTH to respond to more events like ASG lifecycle hooks, EC2 state changes, and Spot ITNs by sourcing events from Amazon EventBridge + Amazon SQS. 

The new queue-processor mode is a preview and is not meant for production environments right now. However, we would love for you to try it out on your test clusters. GA support will follow very soon!

Check out the readme on how to get started with NTH queue-processing mode https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler#installation-and-configuration

## Other Changes:

- The NTH DaemonSet in IMDS mode can now run with `host_networking=false`. The default still uses host networking, but if you'd like to run NTH outside the root network namespace, make sure that IMDSv2 IP hops are configure to 2 instead of the default 1 OR make sure IMDSv1 is still enabled. https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/configuring-instance-metadata-service.html

name: AWS Node Termination Handler v1.8.0
body:
# Features:
1. Support for webhook templates (#253 thanks to @supasteev0 )
1. Improved logs
   - Better support of JSON logging 
   - Log all pods when a node is cordoned (#257 thanks to @wanwenli )
   - Reduced log clutter from new events 

# Other Changes:
1. Upgraded [Amazon EC2 Metadata Mock](https://github.com/aws/amazon-ec2-metadata-mock) version to 1.6
1. Additional retries to improve stability
   - For IMDSv2 401 errors (#244 thanks to @DP19 )
   - For uncordoning nodes (#257 thanks to @nithu0115 )
1. New documentation on simulating interruptions with AEMM

name: AWS Node Termination Handler v1.7.0
body:
## Features:
1. Add availability zone to node metadata for use in webhook templates (https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/210 thanks to @DP19 )

## Other Changes:
1. Moved to [Amazon EC2 Metadata Mock](https://github.com/aws/amazon-ec2-metadata-mock) for end-to-end tests.
1. Moved to go 1.15 and stripped debug tables from binary to make the image slightly smaller.
1. Added helm test to check template generation
1. Added retry logic for installing AEMM in tests to improve test stability

name: AWS Node Termination Handler v1.6.1
body:
## Bugs:
1. Fix helm chart error when deploying to EKS where semver comparison fails because of Minor version having a `+` on the end. (https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/195 thanks to @itssimon for reporting https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/issues/193)
1. Do not schedule to fargate since it won't work correctly anyways (https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/191 thanks to @limed )
1. Fix incorrect flag description for `--ignore-daemon-sets` (https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/194 thanks to @takanabe )

name: AWS Node Termination Handler v1.6.0
body:
## New Features: 🥳  🎉  🎊

1. Experimental Windows support! (https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/185 thanks to @cjerad ) 
1. Support specifying the Webhook URL in a K8s secret (https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/179 thanks to @imuqtadir and @farshad-hobsons for suggesting this feature https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/issues/170)
1. Support adding pod labels in the helm chart (https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/180 thanks to @mwconceicao)

## Bugs:
1. Do not fail on scheduled maintenance event when no end date is present (https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/182 thanks to @yzargari for reporting https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/issues/147)
1. Fix typo in prometheus metrics for "pre-drain" (https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/184 thanks to @zuzzas)


## Docs:
1. Adds a section in the readme on how to use aws-node-termination-handler with Kiam (https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/188 thanks to @leosunmo)

## Tests:

1. Added eks driver for e2e tests on windows nodes

name: AWS Node Termination Handler v1.5.0
body:
## New Features:

1. Optionally taint nodes when a termination event or maintenance event is triggered (https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/162 thanks to @diversario) 
1. Optionally enable a prometheus metrics endpoint (https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/172 thanks to @manute)


## Tests:

1. Added end-to-end tests for tainting nodes
1. Added end-to-end tests for prometheus metrics

name: AWS Node Termination Handler v1.4.0
body:
## New Features:

1. Supports HTTP(S) proxying for webhooks (https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/150) 
1. Supports optional JSON logging (https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/152)
1. Supports an optional cordon-only which only marks the node as unschedulable and does not drain the pods off the node. (https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/145)
1. Removed unneeded K8s permissions given to aws-node-termination-handler in its cluster role. (https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/140)
1. Tolerate all taints by default so that aws-node-termination-handler is launched everywhere. (https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/128)

## Bug Fixes:

1. Fixed a bug where Scheduled Maintenance Events start and end times could not be parsed when the day was a single digit. (https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/148)
1. Fixed a bug where Scheduled Maintenance Event cancellations fail because of an alternative spelling of "canceled". (https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/pull/133)

## Tests:

1. Added end-to-end tests for webhook HTTP proxy
1. Added end-to-end tests for cordon-only feature
1. Upgraded to Kind (Kubernetes-in-Docker) to version 0.8.1 for e2e tests.

name: AWS Node Termination Handler v1.3.1
body:
## Bug Fixes:
  - Fixes a leak in the http client configuration

name: AWS Node Termination Handler v1.3.0
body:
## New Features:

1. Supports [IMDSv2](https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/security/defense-in-depth-open-firewalls-reverse-proxies-ssrf-vulnerabilities-ec2-instance-metadata-service)
1. Supports additional node metadata to construct more detailed webhook notifications. (https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/issues/94)

## Bug Fixes:

1. Fixed IMDS parsing of Spot ITN events and added more IMDS requests to fill in node metadata that was not being returned by the Spot ITN response (https://github.com/aws/aws-node-termination-handler/issues/104).

## Tests:

1. Unit test coverage extended

name: AWS Node Termination Handler v1.2.0
body:
## New Features:

1. NTH now responds to EC2 instance scheduled maintenance events! This feature is experimental, and is by default disabled. You can enable it by using the `--enable-scheduled-event-draining` argument (or the corresponding `ENABLE_SCHEDULED_EVENT_DRAINING` environment variable). Once enabled, NTH will drain the node before the maintenance window begins. In addition, if a system-reboot maintenance event is received, NTH will add a label to your node and uncordon after the reboot has taken place. Read more about scheduled maintenance events here: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/monitoring-instances-status-check_sched.html

1. Webhooks are now supported! 


## Tests:

1. More e2e tests were added for scheduled maintenance events and webhooks
1. Unit tests added

name: AWS Node Termination Handler v1.1.0
body:
## New Features:

1. NTH now allows you to configure how long before the termination event you would like to start draining the node. Use the `--node-termination-grace-period` argument (or `NODE_TERMINATION_GRACE_PERIOD` environment variable) to configure this new functionality. The default value will maintain the same functionality as v1.0.0 which is 120 seconds before the termination event. 


## Changes:

1. Deprecated the "grace-period" argument in favor of "pod-termination-grace-period". Old configurations will still work using "grace-period" but a warning will be logged. 

## Tests:

1. Kind was updated to the latest v0.6.0 for E2E tests. 
1. Tests were broken up into reusable scripts to facilitate more tests with less code
1. goimports test was added to the go-report-card test

name: AWS Node Termination Handler v1.0.0
body:
This release offers the node termination behavior of cordon and draining nodes if they receive a EC2 Spot Instance termination notification (ITN).

## Features:
1. Detect Spot ITN then use Kubernetes API to cordon and drain
1. Retry mechanism for transient network issues connecting to metadata service
1. Optional Ignore Daemonsets
1. Optional Delete-Local-Data
1. Optional Node Selector
1. Optional Dry-Run Mode
1. Integration testing framework
